medical_history.chief_complaint: Deep right groin pain interfering with function.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The groin symptoms began approximately 4 weeks prior to the initial physical therapy visit. Initially presented as intermittent stiffness, later progressing to intense, sharp groin pain and constant aching sensation within 7-10 days before the visit. Pain intensity ranged from 4 to 9 on a scale of 0-10, with weight-bearing provoking the sharp pain.
